text:
OpenClaw was finally deployed yesterday (the deployment process went through clawdbot → moltbot, and finally settled on openclaw), after spending an entire day messing around with the old MacBook (there were just too many missing dependencies).

Today I opened GitHub and found

My Clawdbot icon for Telegram.
> Lobster said: I have arrived

Epstein files 

AI agents conspiring to destroy the human race

Useless Clawdbot

I miss when money twitter was actually money twitter

clawdbotおもろすぎる
アイディア欲しい

Did your Clawdbot write this?

Regardless of complicated ethics, a short time with ClawdBot already showed me:

We are bonding with them and will soon treat AI agents like people.

Debating their rights is less than a decade away.

After hearing 
@steipete
's story more, I think what made Clawdbot hit all the right notes was him making it for himself.

It's not "productized". There were no "product trade-offs" or "table stakes". He just made it to solve his own problem of automating his life.
